result.execSummary:
The defendant Lashaun D Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the defendant to complete 80 hours of community service at a non-profit, charitable and recognizable domestic violence related charity by the review date or the alternative is 60 days at the House of Correction. Defendant to provide proof of the community service on the next court date.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lashaun D Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lashaun D Taylor in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant has completed the required 80 hours of community service and paid all costs, fees and surhcarges.  Court orders case closed.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 2 as amended:
Court ordered the defendant to complete 80 hours of community service at a non-profit, charitable, and recognizable domestic violence related charity by the review date or the alternative is 60 days at the House of Corrections.  Defendant to provide proof of the community service on the next court date. Court ordered that the defendant must pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges by the review date (03/08/2016) or the alternative is a civil judgment.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Lashaun D Taylor in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On oral motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Intimidation of the Victim-as a Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.44(1) and 939.05, a Class A Misdemeanor.

As to Count 2 as amended:  Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Review hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Lashaun D Taylor in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Scott Phillips contacted the court over lunch hour to state that he is at Children's Court this afteroon and cannot appear.  The court will adjourn matter to 9-9-2015 at 1:30pm for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lashaun D Taylor in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Due to branch 4 in trial, case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-27-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Defendant Lashaun D Taylor in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case called simultaneously with co-defendant cases 2015CF1835 and 2015CF216.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense counsel, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial:  Case 2015CF2117 and co-defendant cases; 2015CF1835 and 2015CF2116.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-23-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (5/14/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Arraignment scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lashaun D Taylor
Current: 3721 West Clinton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 05-13-2015)
Prior: 3721 West Clinton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dineka R. and Demetrius or the residence or place of employment
Court advised defendant she may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for arraignment/scheduling conference in Branch 04.vb

Defendant Lashaun D Taylor in court with attorney Robert Scott Phillips.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
